skill.name: go-concurrency-patterns
skill.description: Master Go concurrency with goroutines, channels, sync primitives, and context. Use when building concurrent Go applications, implementing worker pools, or debugging race conditions.
skill.summary: Master Go concurrency with goroutines, channels, sync primitives, and context. Use when building con...

security_audit.summary: The skill contains only documentation and code examples for Go concurrency. No file system, environment, or network exfiltration behavior is present.

content.value_statement: Concurrent Go code can be hard to design and debug. This skill provides proven patterns and examples you can adapt quickly.
actual_capabilities: Explains goroutines, channels, select, and sync primitives
Provides worker pool and fan-in and fan-out pipeline examples
Shows bounded concurrency with semaphore patterns
Includes graceful shutdown with context and signal handling
Covers errgroup usage and concurrency limits
limitations: Does not execute or test code in your environment
Does not cover project specific architecture or dependencies
Examples are Go focused and not cross language
No automated profiling or benchmark guidance

use_cases.title: Design concurrent services
use_cases.description: Select patterns for workers, pipelines, and cancellation in production services.

use_cases.title: Improve graceful shutdown
use_cases.description: Add safe shutdown and timeout handling to running processes.

use_cases.title: Learn concurrency basics
use_cases.description: Understand core primitives with clear examples and best practices.

prompt_templates.title: Explain goroutines
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain goroutines and channels with a small example for a beginner.

prompt_templates.title: Build a worker pool
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a worker pool pattern with context cancellation and result channel.

prompt_templates.title: Add graceful shutdown
prompt_templates.prompt: Show a graceful shutdown pattern using context and OS signals.

prompt_templates.title: Limit concurrency
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare semaphore and errgroup limit patterns and recommend one for API fetches.

output_examples.input: Recommend a concurrency pattern for processing many jobs with cancellation.
output: Use a worker pool with a buffered jobs channel
Pass a context to stop workers on cancel
Close results after all workers finish
Add errgroup if you need early failure

best_practices: Use context for cancellation and deadlines
Close channels from the sender side only
Avoid goroutine leaks with clear exit paths

faq.question: Is this compatible with all Go versions?
faq.answer: Examples target modern Go, and most work from Go 1.17 and newer.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides patterns and examples, not project specific design or testing.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my existing codebase?
faq.answer: Yes, you can adapt the snippets to your services and libraries.

faq.question: Does it access my data or secrets?
faq.answer: No, it only provides documentation and code examples.

faq.question: What if a pattern causes a deadlock?
faq.answer: Review channel ownership and add context cancellation paths.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic Go help?
faq.answer: It focuses on concurrency patterns with ready to use templates.
